page.title: 03A VILLAGE PUB AND BREWERY
page.content: There are 2 Public Houses in the block,both in Marsh Gibbon,one being{"The Greyhound".}The first written records appear in the 1700's. A diary exists which records how a {Richard Heritage}brewed beer there in l833. The present owners extensively renovated the pub and added a restaurant. In 1981 they revived the brewing tradition as the{"Phillips {Brewing Company"}with the landlords eldest son as head brewer.The beers are given names to celebrate village history. For example{" Heritage {Traditional Bitter"}named after the 19th century brewer and{"Alirics Old {Ale"}named after Aliric the Saxon who owned land in Marsh Gibbon before the Norman Conquest. The 199 year old{Marsh Gibbon Friendly {Society}still meets there.
